quote: Wonder rather than doubt is the root of all knowledge.
author: Abraham Joshua Heschel

quote: I think, therefore I'll think.
author: Ayn Rand,  Atlas Shrugged: 35th Anniversary Edition

quote: I started having doubts right on top of my certainty.
author: David James Duncan,  The Brothers K

quote: Doubt … is an illness that comes from knowledge and leads to madness.
author: Gustave Flaubert,  Memoirs of a Madman

quote: When in doubt, choose to live.
author: Terry Pratchett,  Thief of Time

quote: When in doubt, look intelligent.
author: Garrison Keillor

quote: How prone to doubt, how cautious are the wise!
author: Homer

quote: My answer is nope, so don’t even hope.
author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book Has No Title

quote: When in doubt, C-4.
author: Adam Savage

quote: To question reason is to trust it.
author: Mitch Stokes

quote: I dwell in possibility.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Try it before you doubt it, because it might just be for you
author: Rayvon L. Browne

quote: Nothing is ever certain.
author: Alice Sebold,  The Lovely Bones

quote: Doubt is the ally of hope, not its enemy, and together they made all the blessing he had.
author: Barry Unsworth,  Sacred Hunger

quote: Doubt isn't the opposite of faith; it is an element of faith.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: There is no such uncertainty as a sure thing.
author: Robert Burns,  Collected Poems of Robert Burns

quote: Doubt kills more dreams than failure ever will.
author: Suzy Kassem

quote: Because a doubt is not a denial. Doubt is a powerful tool, and it should be applied to history.
author: Walter M. Miller Jr.,  A Canticle for Leibowitz

quote: You can't know, you can only believe - or not.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation.
author: Yann Martel,  Life of Pi

quote: Doubt everything. Find your own light.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: Whether you think you can, or you think you can't--you're right.
author: Henry Ford

quote: I'm no longer quite sure what the question is, but I do know that the answer is Yes.
author: Leonard Bernstein,  The Unanswered Question: Six Talks at Harvard (Charles Eliot Norton Lectures)

quote: The only certainty is death.
author: Guy de Maupassant,  Bel-Ami

quote: There is nothing more dreadful than the habit of doubt. Doubt separates people. It is a poison that disintegrates friendships and breaks up pleasant relations. It is a thorn that irritates and hurts; it is a sword that kills.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: I am hope.
author: Neil Gaiman,  The Sandman, Vol. 1: Preludes and Nocturnes

quote: Anything is possible. Anything can be.
author: Shel Silverstein

quote: I believe that we do not know anything for certain, but everything probably.
author: Christiaan Huygens,  Oeuvres Completes

quote: Life is doubt,And faith without doubt is nothing but death.
author: Miguel de Unamuno

quote: Don't doubt yourself, that's what haters are for.
author: Turcois Ominek

quote: The problem with certainty is that it is static; it can do little but endlessly reassert itself. Uncertainty, by contrast, is full of unknowns, possibilities, and risks. (65)
author: Stephen Batchelor,  Confession of a Buddhist Atheist

quote: We demand rigidly defined areas of doubt and uncertainty!
author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

quote: But then arises the doubt, can the mind of man, which has, as I fully believe been developed from a mind as low as that possessed by the lowest animal, be trusted when it draws such grand conclusions?
author: Charles Darwin,  Life & Letters of Charles Darwin

quote: Anything is Possible!
author: Sealove

quote: Is there any knowledge in the world which is so certain that no reasonable man could doubt it?
author: Bertrand Russell,  The Problems of Philosophy

quote: Doubt thou the stars are fire, Doubt that the sun doth move. Doubt truth to be a liar, But never doubt I love.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I am too much of a skeptic to deny the possibility of anything.
author: Thomas Henry Huxley,  Life and Letters of Thomas Henry Huxley - Volume 1

quote: Faith doesn't mean you never doubt. It only means you never act upon your doubts.
author: Orson Scott Card,  Sarah

quote: All things are possible if you believe...
author: Candace C. Bowen

quote: Modest doubt is call'd the beacon of the wise.
author: William Shakespeare,  Troilus and Cressida

quote: When nothing is sure, everything is possible.
author: Margaret Drabble

quote: As long as your ideas of what's possible are limited by what's actual, no other idea has a chance.
author: Susan Neiman,  Moral Clarity: A Guide for Grown-up Idealists

quote: It's all make believe, isn't it?
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Doubt thou the stars are fire;Doubt that the sun doth move;Doubt truth to be a liar;But never doubt I love.
author: William Shakespeare,  Hamlet

quote: Doubt thou the stars are fire;Doubt that the sun doth move;Doubt truth to be a liar;But never doubt I love .
author: William Shakespeare,  Hamlet

quote: I refuse to answer that question on the grounds that I don't know the answer
author: Douglas Adams

quote: When we are in love we often doubt that which we most believe.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Somebody knows.
author: Ally Carter

quote: I don't want to believe. I want to know.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: My opinions may have changed, but not the fact that I'm right.
author: Ashleigh Brilliant
